section.title: Introduction
section.para: The URL is a string representation for a media location. It specifies the physical access to the media. It does not make any assumptions about the media content.

section.title: General layout
section.para:
A media URL consists of four parts
Media Type
Allowed types are cd, dvd, nfs, ftp, dir, disk, http
Types are not case sensitive
host setting
Used for systems which involve some kind of server. Its possible to optinally add username, password and port parameters
Path on device or server, a simple unix path name
options
this is a type-specific semicolon-separated list of 'key=value' pairs, e.g. 'devices=/dev/cdrom,/dev/cdrecorder' for cd access
Type and path are mandatory. Options and hostname settings can be left out.
All media types except http, https and ftp have the option mountoptions in common. It's value is passed with the -o parameter to mount

example.title: URL for CD access
example.para:
Default device if none specified is /dev/cdrom
cd:///suse cd:///suse;devices=/dev/cdrom,/dev/cdrecorder

example.title: URL for DVD access
example.para:
Default device if none specified is /dev/dvd
dvd:///suse dvd:///suse;devices=/dev/dvd,/dev/dvd1

example.title: URL for NFS access
example.para:
Hostname is mandatory and can be specified as name or IPv4 address. IPv6 is not supported atm.
nfs://nfs.suse.de/var/share/SuSE-Linux/CD1 nfs://12.34.56.78/

example.title: URL for FTP access
example.para:
Same rules as for NFS apply for hostname. Optionally username, password and port can be specified. Addidional options are proxyuser and proxypassword. These two options only take effect if ftp_proxy is set to a http proxy in the environment.
ftp://ftp.suse.com/pub/suse/i386/8.0/suse ftp://ftp:ftp@you.suse.de:21/pub/suse;proxyuser=fritz;proxypassword=gEhEiM

example.title: URL for DISK access
example.para:
Used to access partitions that have to be mounted. Options are device and filesystem
disk:///suse/CD1;device=/dev/hda3;filesystem=xfs

example.title: URL for HTTP access
example.para:
Same rules as for ftp access except the environment variable http_proxy takes effect instead of ftp_proxy
http://disthost.mycompany.com:8080/suse

example.title: URL for HTTPS access
example.para:
Same as HTTP. Server certificate is not validated atm.
https://haegar@maintenance.suse.de/private/area/suse

example.title: URL for SMB access
example.para:
SMB access via smbfs. username and password must be present or the mountoption guest has to be specified. password may not contain comas.
smb://haegar:5ch3ck1ich@kiste/some/share
